oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various Artist Recordings for a West-Vlaanderen, Belgium Radio Station - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is of a radio station, believed to be hosted by Elsfan Herzelley, playing various country music hits . According to insert, tape originates from West-Vlannderen, Belgium. Recording is from October 5, 1972. Tape is number two of an unknown number.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Unidentified fiddle tune [featuring unidentified voiceover] (Unidentified) -- (00:29) An unidentified voice introduces the Country Music Month -- (00:34) Unidentified introductory tune ([Unidentified]) -- (01:31) An unidentified voice introduces Elsfan Herzelley (unconfirmed) and Eric Michael's "Crazy Banjo" -- (01:49) Crazy Banjo (Eric Michael) -- (03:48) Herzelley introduces Howard Vokes' "Break the News" -- (04:01) Break the News (Howard Vokes) -- (06:43) Herzelley introduces Dea Doll's "Mag ik U Vragen Mister" -- (07:00) Mag ik U Vragen Mister (Dea Doll) -- (08:54) An unidentified voice and Herzelley introduce Sue Thompson's "A Full Time Job" -- (09:08) A Full Time Job (Sue Thompson) -- (11:13) Unidentified introductory tune [featuring unidentified voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (11:58) An unidentified voice and Herzelley introduce Bobbejann's "Juul de Stier" -- (12:12) Juul de Stier (Bobbejaan) -- (14:23) An unidentified voice introduces Freddy Hart's "Got the All Overs You" -- (14:33) Got the All Overs You (Freddy Hart) -- (16:55) An unidentified voice introduces Howard Vokes' "West of the Yukon" -- (17:12) West of the Yukon (Howard Vokes) -- (19:16) An unidentified voice introduces various country artists to discuss the Country Music Month and Nelly Jane's "Nobody" -- (21:18) Nobody (Nelly Jane) -- (23:33) Unidentified outro tune [featuring unidentified voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (24:31) Unidentified tune [featuring unidentified and Herzelley voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (26:35) Unidentified fiddle tune [featuring unidentified voiceover] (Unidentified) -- (27:00) Various western soundtracks are played [featuring unidentified voiceover] -- (27:42) An unidentified voice discusses the image of American country music -- (28:21) Bonanza (Geoff Love) -- (30:15) An unidentified voice and Herzelley discuss people's idealization of cowboys -- (30:53) Wat Doet een Cowboy in Amsterdam (Bob Schoepen) -- (32:16) An unidentified voice and Herzelley discuss 'hillbilly' music -- (32:52) The Gold Rush is Over (Hank Snow) -- (35:22) An unidentified voice and Herzelley discuss western movies -- (35:55) White Man (Dennis Payne) -- (38:37) An unidentified voice and Herzelley introduce Tex Ritter's "Chuck Wagon Son of a Gun" -- (38:59) Chuck Wagon Son of a Gun (Tex Ritter) -- (41:27) An unidentified voice and Herzelley discuss Jim Reeves -- (41:47) He'll Have to go (Jim Reeves) -- (44:06) The Virginian (Geoff Love) -- (44:18) An unidentified voice and Herzelley discuss Buck Owens -- (44:44) Buck Owens radio spot -- (45:01) Buck Owens radio spot -- (45:18) Looking Back to See (Buck Owens and Susan Rays) -- (47:41) The Virginian (Geoff Love) -- (47:45) An unidentified voice and Herzelley discuss Johnny Cash -- (48:06) The Troubadour (Johnny Cash) -- (50:14) Unidentified outro tune [featuring unidentified voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (51:10) Gun Law [featuring unidentified and Herzelley voiceover] (Geoff Love) -- (52:40) An unidentified voice and Herzelley radio spot listing contributing parties, and both say goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is in German and a list of the used tracks. Each track has the associated artist listed.
